title: Areas: the towns of Boeotia, central Greece. ' The volume of IG containing Boeotian inscriptions appeared in 1892

The two most recent handbooks dealing with Boeotian are Thurnb—Scherer (1959) and Bliimel (I982). The following publications provide an up-to-date overview of Boeotian material: (i) The Supplement in Jeffery (I990) lists fifteen new references for Boeotian (two for the period 1980-90). Some of these are recorded in SEG. (ii) Bltimel (1982) is a study of the phonology and morphology of the Aeolic dialects, presented in generative terminology. There are appendices at the back entitled (1.1) ‘Verbesserte Lesungen und Re-editionen von IG-Inschriften’, and (1.2) ‘Nach den IG publizierte lnschriften’
